meanings.definition: The state or quality of being swollen or distended.
meanings.sent1: The turgidnesses of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent2: The river's turgidnesses after the heavy rain caused flooding.
meanings.sent3: The turgidnesses of the marshmallow made it comically oversized.
meanings.sent4: The turgidnesses of the clouds before the storm were a sign of the impending rain.
meanings.sent5: The turgidnesses of the water balloon made it ready to burst at any moment.

meanings.definition: The quality of being pompous or excessively ornate in style.
meanings.sent1: Her speech was filled with unnecessary turgidnesses that bored the audience.
meanings.sent2: The turgidnesses of the royal proclamation were met with eye rolls.
meanings.sent3: The turgidnesses of his outfit made him look like a walking museum exhibit.
meanings.sent4: The turgidnesses of the ceremony were like a grand performance on a small stage.
meanings.sent5: The turgidnesses of the decoration overwhelmed the simple beauty of the room.
